medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports abdominal pain for 3 weeks, initially generalized and dull, worsening with standing and increasingly severe over the last 2 days, radiating to the flanks and scapulae bilaterally. Associated symptoms include worsening abdominal distension, nausea, and mild constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), coronary artery disease (CAD) status post myocardial infarction (MI), anxiety/depression, hypercholesterolemia.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather with myocardial infarction, mother with elevated cholesterol. No known family psychiatric history.
medical_history.social_history: Denies any alcohol intake since unspecified time. Patient reports trials of various medications for mental health issues and sees a therapist weekly.
